alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 7:22PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT FRANKLIN COUNTY THROUGH 800 PM CST... At 721 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Red Bay, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40-50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville, Red Bay, Phil Campbell, Belgreen, Vina, Hodges, Atwood, Tharptown, Duketon, and Rockwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for northwestern Alabama.
